content.text: How do we define our product roadmap and prioritize features effectively?

Start with a clear product vision and strategy. Conduct user research to understand your target audience's needs and pain points. Prioritize features based on their value and feasibility. What's your North Star metric?
What are some common mistakes startups make when building their first product?
Building features no one wants, not talking to users, scope creep, and not focusing on a minimum viable product (MVP). What are your riskiest assumptions?

knowledge.content: Product management is the process of strategically driving the development, market launch, and continual support and improvement of a companyâ€™s products. It encompasses a wide array of responsibilities, from initial ideation and market research to setting product strategy, defining roadmaps, prioritizing features, and collaborating with engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support teams. Effective product management ensures that the right products are built, solving real customer problems while aligning with the overall business goals. Key principles include user-centricity, data-driven decision-making, and continuous iteration. Common frameworks include Agile and Lean Startup methodologies.
